verses.text_plain: Then said the Lord unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind could not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.
verses.verse_html: 1Then said the Lord unto me, Though Moses and Samuel stood before me, yet my mind could not be toward this people: cast them out of my sight, and let them go forth.

verses.text_plain: And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the Lord; Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.
verses.verse_html: 2And it shall come to pass, if they say unto thee, Whither shall we go forth? then thou shalt tell them, Thus saith the Lord; Such as are for death, to death; and such as are for the sword, to the sword; and such as are for the famine, to the famine; and such as are for the captivity, to the captivity.

tokens.text: And it shall come to pass, if they say
unto thee, Whither shall we go forth

verses.text_plain: And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the Lord: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy.
verses.verse_html:
3And I will appoint over them four kinds, saith the Lord: the sword to slay, and the dogs to tear, and the fowls of the heaven, and the beasts of the earth, to devour and destroy. ▼
▼ kinds: Heb. families

verses.text_plain: And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html:
4And I will cause them to be removed into all kingdoms of the earth, because of Manasseh the son of Hezekiah king of Judah, for that which he did in Jerusalem. ▼
▼ cause…: Heb. give them for a removing

footnotes.body_text: ▼ cause…: Heb. give them for a removing
footnotes.body_html: ▼ cause…: Heb. give them for a removing

verses.text_plain: For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest?
verses.verse_html:
5For who shall have pity upon thee, O Jerusalem? or who shall bemoan thee? or who shall go aside to ask how thou doest? ▼
▼ how…: Heb. of thy peace?

tokens.text: thee? or who shall go aside

footnotes.body_html: ▼ how…: Heb. of thy peace?

verses.text_plain: Thou hast forsaken me, saith the Lord, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.
verses.verse_html: 6Thou hast forsaken me, saith the Lord, thou art gone backward: therefore will I stretch out my hand against thee, and destroy thee; I am weary with repenting.

verses.text_plain: And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children, I will destroy my people, since they return not from their ways.
verses.verse_html:
7And I will fan them with a fan in the gates of the land; I will bereave them of children, I will destroy my people, since they return not from their ways. ▼
▼ children: or, whatsoever is dear

footnotes.body_html: ▼ children: or, whatsoever is dear

verses.text_plain: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city.
verses.verse_html:
8Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas: I have brought upon them against the mother of the young men a spoiler at noonday: I have caused him to fall upon it suddenly, and terrors upon the city. ▼
▼ the mother…: or, the mother city a young man spoiling, etc, or, the mother and the young men

footnotes.body_text: ▼ the mother…: or, the mother city a young man spoiling, etc, or, the mother and the young men
footnotes.body_html: ▼ the mother…: or, the mother city a young man spoiling, etc, or, the mother and the young men

verses.text_plain: She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 9She that hath borne seven languisheth: she hath given up the ghost; her sun is gone down while it was yet day: she hath been ashamed and confounded: and the residue of them will I deliver to the sword before their enemies, saith the Lord.

verses.text_plain: Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet every one of them doth curse me.
verses.verse_html: 10Woe is me, my mother, that thou hast borne me a man of strife and a man of contention to the whole earth! I have neither lent on usury, nor men have lent to me on usury; yet every one of them doth curse me.

tokens.text: I have neither lent on usury
nor men have lent to me on usury
every one of them doth curse

verses.text_plain: The Lord said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in the time of affliction.
verses.verse_html:
11The Lord said, Verily it shall be well with thy remnant; verily I will cause the enemy to entreat thee well in the time of evil and in the time of affliction. ▼
▼ cause…: or, intreat the enemy for thee

footnotes.body_text: ▼ cause…: or, intreat the enemy for thee
footnotes.body_html: ▼ cause…: or, intreat the enemy for thee

verses.text_plain: Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?
verses.verse_html: 12Shall iron break the northern iron and the steel?

verses.text_plain: Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.
verses.verse_html: 13Thy substance and thy treasures will I give to the spoil without price, and that for all thy sins, even in all thy borders.

verses.text_plain: And I will make thee to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.
verses.verse_html: 14And I will make thee to pass with thine enemies into a land which thou knowest not: for a fire is kindled in mine anger, which shall burn upon you.

verses.text_plain: O Lord, thou knowest: remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.
verses.verse_html: 15O Lord, thou knowest: remember me, and visit me, and revenge me of my persecutors; take me not away in thy longsuffering: know that for thy sake I have suffered rebuke.

tokens.text: that for thy sake I have suffered

verses.text_plain: Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O Lord God of hosts.
verses.verse_html:
16Thy words were found, and I did eat them; and thy word was unto me the joy and rejoicing of mine heart: for I am called by thy name, O Lord God of hosts. ▼
▼ I am…: Heb. thy name is called upon me

footnotes.body_text: ▼ I am…: Heb. thy name is called upon me
footnotes.body_html: ▼ I am…: Heb. thy name is called upon me

verses.text_plain: I sat not in the assembly of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand: for thou hast filled me with indignation.
verses.verse_html: 17I sat not in the assembly of the mockers, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of thy hand: for thou hast filled me with indignation.

verses.text_plain: Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar, and as waters that fail?
verses.verse_html:
18Why is my pain perpetual, and my wound incurable, which refuseth to be healed? wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar, and as waters that fail? ▼
▼ fail: Heb. be not sure?

tokens.text: wilt thou be altogether unto me as a liar

footnotes.body_html: ▼ fail: Heb. be not sure?

verses.text_plain: Therefore thus saith the Lord, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, and thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.
verses.verse_html: 19Therefore thus saith the Lord, If thou return, then will I bring thee again, and thou shalt stand before me: and if thou take forth the precious from the vile, thou shalt be as my mouth: let them return unto thee; but return not thou unto them.

tokens.text: then will I bring thee again
me: and if thou take forth
thou shalt be as my mouth

verses.text_plain: And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall: and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 20And I will make thee unto this people a fenced brasen wall: and they shall fight against thee, but they shall not prevail against thee: for I am with thee to save thee and to deliver thee, saith the Lord.

tokens.text: against thee, but they shall not prevail

verses.text_plain: And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
verses.verse_html: 21And I will deliver thee out of the hand of the wicked, and I will redeem thee out of the hand of the terrible.
